numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice a general pattern.
2. Many people who are 15 years old to 24 years old think that the world is getting better with each generation.
3. Fewer people who are 40 years old or older think that the world is getting better with each generation.
4. I find this pattern interesting.
5. People often think that younger generations are pessimistic.
6. People often think that younger generations are negative.
7. The graph indicates the opposite.
8. The US is far from the line in the graph.
9. The US has a positive residual.
10. In the US, more young people think that the world is getting better with each generation.
11. In the US, fewer older people think that the world is getting better with each generation.
12. I wonder if the world during the childhood of older people shaped their feelings about future generations.
13. Older people might be negative because new ideas are surfacing.
14. Older people might be negative because new concepts are surfacing.
15. Older people might not be used to these new ideas and concepts.
16. Many people do not like change.
17. I wonder what the data of other countries looks like.
18. I wonder why the survey includes only these countries.
19. If the survey included other countries, the graph might look completely different.
20. I wonder how people who are 25 years old to 39 years old feel about the world.
21. This topic relates to me and my community.
22. I am in the younger generation.
23. I am surprised that many young people are positive.
24. It often feels to me that young people are not positive.
25. The title is: The World - Half Full or Half Empty?
